class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|elts>> is a list of pair
      <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~(service~, content~)>>~, creates a list of link towards the
      <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|service>>s~. ~See the ~Eliom manual for an <<a_manual
      chapter="misc" fragment="basic_menu"|example of menu>>~.


      ~The optional parameter <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|service>> is used to find which item~(s~)
      to highlight ~(by adding the class <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|eliomtools~_current>> to the
      corresponding <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~<li~>>> node~)~. ~The default is to highlight the item
      corresponding to the current url~.


      ~The optional parameters <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|id>> and <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|classe>> allow to specify the
      corresponding attributes in the generated <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~<ul~>>> node~. ~The
      default class for the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~<ul~>>> node is <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|eliomtools~_menu>>~.
>>

| type Eliom_content.Html.elt >> list>>>><<div class="odocwiki_info"|~The function <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|hierarchical~_menu~_depth~_first site ~(~)>> constructs
      a hieranrchical menu by exploring the hierarchical <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|site>>
      description using a depth~-first algorithm~: the first menu item
      will be displayed~, followed by the whole sub~-menu for this item~,
      then the second menu item with its sub~-menu~, and so on~.


      ~By default~, only the sub~-menus for to the url corresponding to
      the optional argument <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|service>> are displayed~, others sub~-menu
      are collapsed~. ~If you want all the sub~-menus to be displayed~,
      specify <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~~whole~_tree~:true>>~. ~If the optional parameter <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|service>>
      is not given~, the current page is used~.


      ~See <<a_api subproject="server" | val Eliom_tools.HTML5_TOOLS.menu >> for a description of the optional parameters <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|id>>
      and <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|classe>>~.
>>

      constructs a hierarchical menu by exploring the hierarchical
      <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|site>> description using a breadth~_first algorithm~: the whole
      menu for one level will be displayed~, followed by the sub~-menu
